components.description:
An open, hardcover book, depicted with a blue cover on most platforms. Some platforms include a bookmark. Commonly used for various content concerning reading, writing, learning, and schooling.

Apple’s design displays text from its 1997–2002 Think Different ad campaign:

Here’s to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes.The ones who see things differently. They’re not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can’t do is…

Google’s design previously featured a brown cover with a red bookmark, similar to an early design for ðŸ“• Closed Book.

title: Open Book

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Office symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An open, hard-back book with blue cover. In the Apple artwork for this emoji, the book is open to a page with the following text: Hereâ€™s to  http://emojipedia.org/open-book/
emoji_net_data.name: open book

bn:00082596v: Consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning
To consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning.

bn:00082281v: To acquire knowledge on a subject.
To acquire, or attempt to acquire knowledge or an ability to do something.

bn:00092424v: Interpret something that is written or printed

bn:00030716n: Learning is the act of acquiring new, or modifying and reinforcing, existing knowledge, behaviors, skills, values, or preferences and may involve synthesizing different types of information.
Profound knowledge, especially that based on learning and scholarship.
Learning is the acquisition and development of memories and behaviors, including skills, knowledge, understanding, values, and wisdom.
Acquiring new, or modifying existing, knowledge
Knowledge acquired by study, research, etc.

bn:00012059n: A written work or composition that has been published (printed on pages bound together)
A book is a set of written, printed, illustrated, or blank sheets, made of ink, paper, parchment, or other materials, usually fastened together to hinge at one side.
A collection of sheets of paper bound together to hinge at one edge, containing printed or written material, pictures, etc.

Quotations about books: All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you; the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse, and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was.
Also called "dead tree edition" or "dead tree book" (humorously)
Medium for a collection of words and/or pictures to represent knowledge, often manifested in bound paper and ink, or in e-books
Collection of sheets of paper bound together containing printed or written material.
